(a)

Geometric sum formulae is

S_n = \frac {a(r^n - 1)} {r - 1}

Let n = \infin Substitute terms

S_n = \frac {{\frac 1 2}(- 1)} {{\frac 1 2} - 1} = 1

(b)

1 \over n(n+1)

can be decomposed to

\frac 1 n - \frac 1 {n+1}

therefore

\displaystyle\sum_{n=1}^\infin \frac 1 {n(n+1)} = 1 - \frac 1 {n+1}

It converges to 1 when n = \infin.

(c)

\log a + \log b = \log ab

therefore

\displaystyle\sum_{n=1}^k \log \left( \frac {n+1} n \right) = \log \left(k+1 \right)

\log is not bounded so it diverges.

q.content:
For each series, find an explicit formula for the sequence of partial sums and determine if the series converges.

(a) \displaystyle\sum_{n=1}^\infin \frac 1 {2^n} \quad (b) \displaystyle\sum_{n=1}^\infin \frac 1 {n(n+1)} \quad (c) \displaystyle\sum_{n=1}^\infin \log \left( \frac {n+1} n \right)
